ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Empty order.xml file when creating	profiles and jobs in 1.14	and 1.12.1
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Gordon and  nfoscarini: Thanks for your help. I am indeed running on Ubuntu Linux. Ubuntu (and Debian) now have full support for Sun s Java, and I have it

	profiles and jobs in 1.14	and 1.12.1
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=235746949

Hi Gordon and  nfoscarini:

Thanks for your help.

I am indeed running on U=
buntu Linux. Ubuntu (and Debian) now have full support for Sun's Java, and =
I have it installed, and assumed that was what I was using. However, I also=
 have gcj installed, and it turns out that Ubuntu uses gcj in preference to=
 Sun's Java. Changing the Java preferences to default to Sun java seems to =
have fixed everything--I am 20MB into a first crawl.

For the benefit of an=
yone else thinking of using Ubuntu, here's what you need to run (at minimum=
) to get Heritrix working in Ubuntu 7.10:

apt-get install sun-java6-jre 
u=
pdate-java-alternatives --set java-6-sun

If you're planning on building fr=
om source you'll want a few other packages, particularly sun-java6-jdk.

FW=
IW, Heritrix *almost* runs in gcj. The exception from heritrix_out.log in i=
ncluded below FYI.

Gordon

>>> Gor=
don Mohr <gojomo@...> 29/03/08 5:31 a.m. >>>
The 'no root element' =
alerts suggests something wrong with the XML 
processing, and if you're usi=
ng the Ubuntu-bundled gcj, I'd try Sun's 
Java as the first step.

AFAIK, H=
eritrix has always had problems running on gcj, and we've never 
tried to g=
et it working or tested it there. I know it's improved a lot, 
so it might =
work someday or with some extra effort -- but also, Sun's 
Java seems on th=
e path to being fully GPL'd, so may become the default 
in Linux distros so=
on.

- Gordon @ IA

Gordon Paynter wrote:
> Hi all:
> 
> I have just instal=
led version 1.14 (the first install I have done since 1.5!). I have found t=
hat when I create a new profile through the web UI, the order.xml file crea=
ted is empty.  This carries over to jobs created using that profile: they h=
ave an empty order.xml file too. Obviously, these jobs don't work. 
> 
> I =
have also tried Heritrix 1.12.1 and I see the same behaviour, so presumably=
 the problem is at my end. I have listed the Alerts I get below. 
> 
> 
> H=
ere are a few more details:
> 
> When I create the profile in the web UI, I=
 edit it and change the User-Agent and From header fields.  If I go back an=
d edit it again in the web UI, my changes are still there, even though the =
order.xml file in the profile directory is zero bytes. If I stop Heritrix a=
nd restart, my changes are gone in the web UI too (suggests these values ar=
e cached?). 
> 
> If I add seeds to the profile, the seeds.xml file is save=
d correctly in the profile directory (and used in any job) alongside the em=
pty order.xml file.
> 
> 
> Looking back in the mailing list, I see Sonja S=
chaule reported the same problem on 12/12/07 but got no response.
> 
> Also=
 looking back on the mailing list I think someone else (Eric Hetzner?) stat=
ing that the Java packaged with Ubuntu/Debian was "not worth bothering with=
". Could this be the problem?  And why--a crazy Debian security measure?
> =

> TIA.
> Gordon
> 
>
